intro: Vincetoxicum linearisepalum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thornapple, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. Its stems are often hairy and can have thorn-like protrusions, giving it a distinctive appearance. The fruit is a follicle that splits open to release small, hard seeds.
